explanation:
The report is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 states that a function parameter shall not be modified; while the object pointed to by a pointer parameter may be changed, the pointer itself shall not be reassigned. In this function the pointer parameter data is reassigned (data += bytes_left; and later data += SHA256_BLOCK_SIZE;) and the scalar parameter length is also modified (length -= bytes_left; length -= SHA256_BLOCK_SIZE;). Both are modifications of function parameters and therefore violate Rule 17.8. (Modifying ctx->count is allowed because ctx is a pointer parameter but the rule permits modifying the object referred to, not reassigning the pointer.)

Fix: introduce local variables and operate on them, e.g. const uint8_t *p = data; size_t len = length; and update p/len instead of the parameters, then use p/len in the rest of the function.
